review_title: Lower salary for long term employees, unsafe work environment, sexism, nepotism rampant.

cons: Your salary increase will be 3% or less every 1-3 years. newer hires with less experience and criminal backgrounds will be offered $10k or more if the spot needs filled. Massive amounts of sexism as evidenced by pay differentials and treatment of staff male staff receive preference by managers of any gender. Job security isn’t great, the new ownership is out of Michigan ( Trinity Health) they care about cutting costs and programs so there is a good chance your job will be cut. New CEO doesn’t advocate for the agency or staff to Allegheny county DHS. Unsafe - if a client threatens bodily harm to you, your family or your home. The company may ask you to press charges and then turn around and ask you to work with that client after the threat. This does not promote a safe working environment. Management are often under resourced, under trained in communication, empathy, and employment law. They are are product of an environment that promotes overproduction over quality care.

review_title: Horrible Senior Management and HR, good benefits and staff.
pros: Benefits are good, staff is caring
cons: The major drawback to Mercy is that Senior Management is unbearable.  Staff is expected to live and die for Mercy and to put family and any other aspect of life second to work.  Micromanaging is the norm, and any independent decisions made by staff are always second guessed by management.  No decision is 100% correct, and all decisions are used as "opportunities for growth" which is code for being written up; however, should staff not act independently, they are also written up.  Basically, you can't win.  Staff are expected to be available by phone or pager 24/7 to cover call offs or emergencies but are not compensated for having to always be available.
